Intergalactic Friendship Day - Celebrated on the 10th of October, Intergalactic Friendship Day honors the bond between beings from different planets and galaxies. On this day, people come together to share stories of their encounters with extraterrestrial life, and to promote peaceful communication and cooperation between interstellar civilizations. Confidence Score: 0.8

Earth Day Extravaganza - This holiday, celebrated on the 25th of March, commemorates the planet's incredible diversity and beauty. People are encouraged to participate in eco-friendly activities, such as tree planting, beach cleanups, and wildlife conservation efforts. Confidence Score: 0.9

Unplugged Day - In an increasingly digital world, Unplugged Day (held on the 20th of February) encourages individuals to disconnect from their devices and reconnect with the natural world. Participants are challenged to spend the day without using any electronic devices, and are encouraged to engage in activities such as meditation, journaling, and outdoor exploration. Confidence Score: 0.8

World Gratitude Festival - This holiday, celebrated on the 15th of August, is dedicated to expressing appreciation for the people, experiences, and things that bring joy and fulfillment to our lives. People are encouraged to share their gratitude through acts of kindness, creative expression, and personal reflection. Confidence Score: 0.9

International Hygge Day - Hygge (pronounced "hoo-gah") is a Danish concept that embodies coziness, comfort, and contentment. On the 10th of December, people come together to share warm drinks, soft blankets, and good company, as they celebrate the art of hygge. Confidence Score: 0.9
